question: Agile team A struggles to deliver committed stories due to technical dependencies with team B, which continuously fails to meet its delivery commitments. What should the agile team lead do?

options.A: Create a new team to deliver the dependencies, and bring team B under performance management.
options.B: Conduct a vision-sharing session with the teams to communicate the project's overall goals.
options.C: Swap team members from both teams so that deliveries are better supported.
options.D: Discuss negotiating the delivery timelines with team A.

question: During a Kanban team's daily stand up, an agile coach observes that the team seems disinterested in the work status. While it appears that there are no issues with flow, there is a marked lack of attention to team effort. When the agile coach queries the team for reasons, members explain that work continues to be scheduled with no end in sight. What should the agile coach do?

options.A: Work with the team to determine points at which to celebrate its work.
options.B: Provide the team with a break by scheduling a team event.
options.C: Have the team increase work in progress (WIP) levels to more quickly complete the flow.
options.D: Rejuvenate the team by temporarily reducing WIP levels.

question: A globally distributed project team is using email and phone calls as the only way to share information. Delays in resolving issues often occur due to misinterpreted communications, leading to a lower team velocity. What steps should the project leader take to improve knowledge sharing?

options.A: Meet individually with each team member to identify the issues and relay information to the remaining members through status reports.
options.B: Establish a live video feed between the dispersed teams to enable spontaneous engagement and collaboration on issues.
options.C: Request that the customer co-locate the team to overcome the communication issues, as this is the only method to ensure agility.
options.D: Inform the customer of the challenges and lower velocity of the project to accommodate for the slower delivery pace.

question: An agile project has three more iterations before the release. There is a lot of report functionality to be created and defects to be cleared. During a daily scrum, a team member suggests a timebox spike to find a more efficient way to deliver reports. What should the project leader do?

options.A: Encourage the team to self-organize and determine how to best complete their existing work and this spike.
options.B: Encourage the team to complete their just existing work since the team velocity indicates they are already struggling to meet the release goal.
options.C: Direct the team to defer the spike until the next release and add the action on the backlog for prioritization.
options.D: Direct the team to work on the spike immediately given the importance of reporting functionality to complete the iteration.

question: A scrum team has eight developers, but only two are database engineers. During the last few retrospectives, the team identified that most sprint stories are dependent upon database engineers. This has created a bottleneck in completing stories. What should be proposed to the team?

options.A: Have other team developers attend training to learn database skills.
options.B: Monitor the retrospectives of two additional sprints before taking action.
options.C: Plan fewer stories for the sprint to reduce the database engineers' workload.
options.D: Ask the scrum master to work with the product owner to remove backlog stories that have database dependency.

question: The executive leadership wants to understand ways to better deliver on time and on budget. What can the project team do to assist in achieving the organizational goal?

options.A: Maintain and review a lessons learned repository to improve delivery of future projects.
options.B: Ask each team member to post corrective action to the backlog.
options.C: Engage the project management office (PMO) to take responsibility identifying lessons learned on projects.
options.D: Perform a root cause analysis to identify alternative approaches for performing the next project.

question: An agile team discovers a new risk and identifies that its impact may be severe. What should an agile practitioner recommend?

options.A: Add a goal to the current iteration to fully mitigate or control the risk.
options.B: Balance risk reduction and value adding activities in the next iteration.
options.C: Continue with the current plan to maintain team velocity.
options.D: Update the risk register and seek direction from a risk specialist.

question: A new agile team member notices that the team's current process involves excessive documentation. What should the new team member do?

options.A: Teach the team the appropriate agile principle, obtain consensus, and drive adoption.
options.B: Allow another team member to prepare those documents that do not appear to bring value.
options.C: Notify the project manager about other documentation techniques, and identify which documents bring value and which do not.
options.D: Follow the existing process to avoid conflicts.

question: After seeing the planned features for an upcoming release, a customer notes that a vitally important and complex one is missing. The team estimates that this feature significantly exceeds its average velocity. How can this issue be resolved?

options.A: Break down the feature into smaller parts, and commit to completing the minimum viable product.
options.B: Complete the iteration to which they have already committed, and include the feature in the next release.
options.C: Change the planned features to include only the vitally important one.
options.D: Extend the iteration to complete the feature.

question: A company president is concerned about the impact of a natural disaster on the company. How should management identify areas to apply its resources and mitigate potential impacts?

options.A: Establish and keep an active risk register that includes mitigation strategies and a cost-benefit analysis.
options.B: Establish and keep an active risk register based on qualitative risk analysis and expected losses.
options.C: Have each development team post the highest risk development items on the information radiator.
options.D: Avoid risk by splitting development teams into two locations to ensure knowledge continuity.

question: A scrum master is part of a project team using technologies overseen by the IT department. The IT director oversees several company initiatives and is unfamiliar with the details of each one. As an active project stakeholder, to which meeting should the IT director be invited?

During backlog refinement meeting, the new developer on the team asks the product owner to discuss a new performance threshold requirement and how it impacts the stories in the backlog. What should the team do?

options.A: Add this threshold requirement request as acceptance criteria in all impacted stories
options.B: Create a spike story to analyze the impact of the threshold requirement on current stories
options.C: Conduct design planning session to review the performance threshold requirement
options.D: Identify the tasks for the new performance threshold requirement

question: During a daily stand up meeting, a developer expresses concerns that the selected technology limits the number of concurrent users. What should the agile team lead do?

options.A: Ask the team to conduct research to find a viable solution.
options.B: Select a better technology for team implementation.
options.C: Obtain customer input on their technology requirements.
options.D: Consult the product owner about their non-functional requirements.

question: Based on the chart (see chart), what is the current status of the iteration when comparing story points planned versus completed?

options.C: The iteration is ahead of schedule.

question: A product's scope and acceptance criteria have been defined, and the product is planned for release at the end of the next quarter. What should the project team do next?

options.B: Determine how much work can be delivered.
options.C: Calculate how much work will fit into the next iteration.
options.D: Estimate items in the product backlog.

question: During sprint retrospectives, some team members are very vocal and tend to dominate the conversation, while others are more reserved and less likely to participate. What should the scrum master do?

options.A: Encourage all team members to participate, and have them type their retrospective feedback into the agile lifecycle management tool.
options.B: Ask more specific questions during the retrospectives.
options.C: Use retrospective techniques, such as silent writing, clustering, and dot voting to field feedback prior to discussion by the team.
options.D: Ask team members to email feedback that can be summarized in a spreadsheet for the team.

question: An agile practitioner notices that team members are disengaged. As a result, the team's velocity has decreased. What should the agile practitioner do to get the team back on track?

options.A: Escalate the issue to the project sponsor.
options.C: Hold a standup to address the issue.

question: A project team is discussing the priorities associated with different project management methodologies. What would an agile practitioner say is the top priority?

options.B: Individuals and interactions and lightweight processes and tools
options.C: Customer satisfaction through delivery of valuable products
options.D: Responding to change and progressive elaboration of plans

question: An agile coach suggests that a lean product development team use a value stream mapping technique in their continuous improvement efforts. What is the primary purpose of this technique?

options.A: Improving and applying consistent coding standards
options.B: Identifying and eliminating non-essential process tasks or activities to decrease cycle time
options.C: Ensuring only the highest value and highest quality deliverables are produced
options.D: Creating a visual map of a process that can be used by other teams to build value for their customers

question: During a sprint review, the product owner rejects one of the product features that the development team demonstrated. What happens next to the user story according to which the rejected feature was developed?

options.A: The user story is automatically placed into the sprint backlog of the next sprint
options.B: The user story is deleted from the product backlog and dropped from the project
options.C: The user story is rewritten to address the reasons why they were not accepted
options.D: The user story is placed in the product backlog to be reprioritized

question: In an effort to increase agile knowledge, traditional project managers of a company have been paired with scrum masters to observe them lead their teams. One observation is that many project decisions are the responsibility of the project team and the scrum master is more facilitative than authoritative. In fact, the scrum masters seem more focused on ensuring that the team can focus on the work, have a shared vision, and determine how they will accomplish their work. What leadership approach have the scrum masters adopted?
An agile team finished coding for the current iteration. Which of the following is a continuous process improvement ceremony that the team will now attend?

A development team is using an eXtreme Programming (XP) development practice that frequently incorporates new and updated code into the project code repository. What technique is the development team using?
A scrum master is starting a project with a new team and needs to develop an estimate of velocity. What should the scrum master use as a basis for velocity in the first sprint?
On an agile project, the team completed the creation of a potentially shippable product increment. Of the following, which represents the length of time that it took to create this product increment?
An agile practitioner has developed a prioritized matrix that describes which product features will be delivered in each release over time. What has the agile practitioner created?
A team lead is currently demonstrating a potentially shippable product increment for project stakeholders. Which agile meeting is being conducted?
An agile team has decided to create an artifact to demonstrate the product increment for the purpose of gathering feedback from the stakeholders. How should the project team accomplish this task?
An agile practitioner needs to track the team's performance over time. How might the agile practitioner accomplish this task?

options.A: Report the team's performance using real time
options.C: Capture the number of escaped defects
options.D: Create an estimate of the project's CPI

question: An agile team is estimating the level of effort necessary to complete their user stories. They decide to make the assumption that the team members will not have any interruptions to project work and will be productive 100% of the time. Which of the following is the team using?

A product owner and the scrum team members are conducting their first sprint planning meeting. The user stories are read to the team, and the team members have provided estimates to complete these user stories. As the team proceeds to develop the user stories during the sprint, what should the product owner do?

options.A: Add more features for the team to develop so they can deliver more value
options.B: Let the team work and answer any questions that might arise during this sprint
options.C: Shield the team from interruptions and facilitate discussions for the team members
options.D: Extend the sprint's length if it appears the team cannot complete the work on time

question: An agile team does not think it can meet the release deadline based on their velocity midway through the release's iterations. What should the team do?

options.A: Meet with the product owner to discuss a new release date
options.B: Add more developers to the team
options.C: Slice user stories so that the team can increase velocity
options.D: Meet with the product owner to re-prioritize the backlog

question: An agile team is demonstrating a recently developed product. Who determines when a product is complete?
An agile team wants to determine the root cause of a recurring issue. Which method would an agile practitioner select to determine the root cause?
An agile team lead has many years of experience and is a subject matter expert on the product that the team is building. How can the team lead best engage the team in solving a problem?

options.A: Steer the team towards what the team lead knows is the best option
options.B: Consult the team on every decision
options.C: Encourage the team to experiment with different potential solutions
options.D: Engage the team in documenting the pros and cons of different solutions

question: Which of the following is an appropriate measure to express the effort associated with user stories?
Where would you expect to find the epic stories in the product backlog?

options.B: Not present in the product backlog

question: When would an Agile project be appropriate?

options.A: A simple project where the requirements are mostly undetermined
options.B: A simple project where the requirements are firmly set
options.C: A complex project where the requirements are mostly undetermined
options.D: A complex project where the requirements are firmly set

question: A theme is ______

options.C: The central idea or purpose behind a group of stories, iteration, or a release

question: Which of the following is a key skill for a servant leader?
A team estimated that the total ideal time requirement for a proposed set of work items is 500 hours. How should this be translated into elapsed time?

options.A: Based on a conversion rate of ideal to actual time at a team level
options.C: By estimating the distractions expected for each team member
options.D: By breaking each task at a granular level and reestimating the actual time

question: If the agile project is release timeboxed, which of the following is true?

options.A: There is no flexibility in the schedule
options.B: The team should use MoSCoW prioritization to create a feature buffer
options.C: The iteration schedule can be extended
options.D: It is pointless to estimate as it is a 'death march' project

question: In a large project, the team identified the highest priority features and completed them first. The remaining features are almost at the same priority level and the team is confused which one to work on first. How should this be addressed?

options.A: By completing the remaining stories in any order
options.B: By considering technical convenience as the key factor in determining sequence from this point
options.D: By waiting for a few more high priority features to emerge before starting new work

question: The team suggested estimates. The range of estimates were plotted on a graph with no names and discussed. What method did the team use
Which estimating technique can be used when there is limited amount of time to estimate a large number of stories
A large product requires 4 teams working in parallel. How many product owners should be assigned to this product
A large product requires four teams working in parallel. How many product backlogs should be produced
After discovering the bottleneck or constraining step in a Kanban system, the first step should be to:

options.A: Add resources to the constraining step
options.B: Find ways to speed up the step with existing resources
options.D: Shift work away from the constraining step

question: Throughout the project, velocity of the team has been unexpectedly falling. What does this mean?

options.A: It is a cause of concern as the team is not able to display predictability
options.B: It is a cause of concern as it will affect the team performance feedback
options.C: It is not a cause of concern as the cycle time should improve
options.D: It is not a cause of concern as it will not impede the customer value

question: The process of cost estimating is accurate when _________________.

options.A: Costs are estimated at the end of each iteration
options.B: Costs are estimated when the product backlog is completed
options.C: Costs go down as iterations progress
options.D: Costs are estimated using burn rate, velocity, product backlog, and release plan

question: The best way to represent the work remaining on a project is _________________.

A team finds that although they deliver working product increments every iteration, they are not deployed quickly enough due to the operational teams not being in a state of readiness. Which of the following techniques is most likely to help the team overcome this problem?

A team was working on a project with a release backlog of 200 points. Between iterations 1 and 3, they completed 50 points of work and the product owner added 20 points of work to the release. What should be the bottom of the burndown bar chart?

A team was working on a project with a release backlog of 200 points. Between iterations 1 and 3, they completed 50 points of work and the product owner added 20 points of work to the release. What should be the top of the burndown bar chart?
Which of the following is true about payback period calculation?

options.A: Payback period should not be used by itself
options.B: Payback period should only be used when risk is included
options.C: A shorter payback period is better than a larger one
options.D: Payback periods should be compared with other projects

question: What is the best metric to compare two agile teams ?
What activity can the agile team do to list the reasons why a particular process was failing during iteration?
During a retrospective meeting what should the team do after they have set the stage?
An agile team considers the risks on the project and includes tasks to address them as part of the project work. This is done using:
The Kanban board is a simple artifact that serves all of the following purposes except:
A product roadmap is used as a ____________.
What activity can the agile team do to list the reasons why a particular process was failing during iteration?
During a retrospective meeting what should the team do after they have set the stage?
An agile team considers the risks on the project and includes tasks to address them as part of the project work. This is done using:
User stories feature which of the following components?
Which circumstance would be a good fit for the use of personas?

options.A: When the conversation is centered on the high-level flow of a process
options.B: When we are trying to better understand stakeholder demographics and general needs
options.C: When we need to capture the high-level objective of a specific requirement
options.D: When we want to communicate what features will be included in the next release

question: When comparing communication styles, which of the following is true?

options.A: Paper-based communication has the lowest efficiency and the highest richness.
options.B: Face-to-face communication has the highest efficiency and the lowest richness.
options.C: Paper-based communication has the highest efficiency and the lowest richness.
options.D: Face-to-face communication has the highest efficiency and the highest richness.

question: You notice your team saying things like 'Team B has no clue again.' What level of conflict are they experiencing?
High-visibility project displays are sometimes called:
The INVEST mnemonic for user stories looks for attributes that include:
Burn down charts display the following attributes on their axes:

options.A: X axis = points remaining; Y axis = calendar time
options.B: X axis = estimated time remaining; Y axis = calendar time
options.C: X axis = calendar time; Y axis = estimated effort remaining
options.D: X axis = calendar time; Y axis = calendar time

question: Wireframe models help agile teams to:
What is velocity not used for?

options.A: Gauging the work capacity of the team
options.C: Getting a sense of work done per iteration

question: The definition of done is frequently discussed with stakeholders so that:

options.A: Functionality can be negotiated until the last responsible moment.
options.B: Everyone has a clear understanding of what completion means.
options.C: Team members get to improve their negotiation skills.
options.D: Active listening reveals previously undiscussed requirements.

question: Which circumstance is a good fit for using user stories?

options.A: When the conversation is centered on the high-level flow of a process
options.B: When we are trying to better understand stakeholder demographics and general needs
options.C: When we need to capture the high-level objective of a specific requirement
options.D: When we want to communicate what features will be included in the next release

question: Agile modeling aims to:

options.A: Capture the intent of the design in a barely sufficient way
options.B: Capture the intent of the design in detail-oriented way
options.C: Deliver extraneous documentation for the project
options.D: Recognize that the value of modeling increases with time spent

question: Which of the following is a valid requirements hierarchy progression from large to small?
Your team seems to unproductively debate even trivial decisions. To help them along, you could try:
Which statement is true for measuring team velocity?

options.A: Velocity is not accurate when there are meetings that cut into development time.
options.B: Velocity measurements are disrupted when some project resources are part-time.
options.C: Velocity tracking does not allow for scope changes during the project.
options.D: Velocity measurements account for work done and disruptions on the project.

question: You have been assigned to lead a geographically distributed agile team. To assist with communication, the best option would be to:

options.A: Ask team members to send photos of themselves so you know what they look like.
options.B: Choose a common language for project communications.
options.C: Set up some initial face-to-face meetings for everyone to meet.
options.D: Define common working hours so everyone can better communicate.

question: The relationship between leadership and management in agile methods is:

options.A: Leadership replaces all aspects of management.
options.C: Management and leadership are used together.
options.D: Management and leadership are not compatible.

question: Wrreframes, personas, and user stories can all playa part in understanrung stakeholder objectives. Which of the circumstances outlined below would be a good fitfor the use of wireframes?

options.A: When the conversation is centered on the high-level flow of a process
options.B: When we are trying to better understand stakeholder demographics and general needs
options.C: When we need to capture the high-level objective of a specific requirement
options.D: When we want to communicate what features will be included in the next release

question: Which are the recommended pairings of adaptive leadership and team phases?

options.A: Supporting and Norming, Delegating and Performing, Directing and Forming, Coaching and Storming
options.B: Directing and Forming, Coaching and Storming, Delegating and Norming, Supporting and Performing
options.C: Directing and Forming, Supporting and Storming, Delegating and Norming, Coaching and Performing
options.D: Directing and Forming, Supporting and Norming, Coaching and Performing, Delegating and Storming

question: __________ is the agile name given to undocumented information supported through team communications.
Self-organizing teams are most readily characterized by their ability to:
Which of the following is not a recommendation for one-on-one coaching?
High-performing teams feature which of the following sets of characteristics?
Which of the following sets of tools is least likely to be utilized by an agile team?
Which of the following is a valid list of the quadrants of emotional intelligence?
The three questions answered in daily stand-up meetings aim to:
Who typically has the best insight into task execution?
Which of the following are recommended brainstorming techniques?
Servant leadership roles include:

options.C: Determining which features to include in an iteration

question: Which of the following statements is false for distributed teams?

options.B: Should have an easier Storming phase
options.C: Need to spend more effort communicating
options.D: Have a higher need for videoconferencing

question: Another project manager of an agile project in your organization comes to you for advice. She is having trouble getting her team to take ownership of the project and get comfortable selecting the work to be done. She keeps finding herself making the decisions and directing their work. What advice can you offer her?

options.A: Play round-robin at stand-up meetings, assigning a different person each day as the decision maker to get them comfortable in the role.
options.B: Implement an incentive plan and officially report any lack of participation to team members' functional managers.
options.C: Meet them halfway and work with their functional managers to align each team member's goals with the project goals.
options.D: Explain to them that agile teams self-select their work and tell them to get on with it.

question: Tuckman's stages of team formation and development progress in what sequence?
Blanchard and Hersey's adaptive leadership phases, in sequence, are:
Which of the following emotional intelligence pairings is an appropriate combination?
The primary reason constructive disagreement is valued on high-performing agile teams is to:
At what team formation and development phase is conflict likely to be highest?
Your team committed to delivering 10 storypoints this iteration, but it looks like you will only complete 8. You should:

options.B: Add more resources to the team.
options.C: Complete 8 points, and put 2 back in the backlog.
options.D: Adjust the iteration plan from 10 points down to 8.

question: Which of the following collections of planning units is most typical for agile projects?

options.A: A release plan containing multiple projects, each with multiple iterations
options.B: A project plan containing multiple releases, each with multiple iterations
options.C: A project plan containing multiple iterations, each containing multiple releases
options.D: An iteration plan containing multiple projects, each containing multiple releases

question: When converting size estimates to duration, remember to:

options.A: Ignore distractions and use ideal time
options.B: Divide the timebox capacity by the number of stories
options.C: Factor in distractions and use available time
options.D: Calculate the payback period for the estimated duration

question: The project management office is auditing your agile project and asks to see your iteration plans. They notice that only the next couple of iterations have plans. As a result, they give the project a 'red flag' for having incomplete plans. The most responsible thing to do is:

options.A: Explain the principles of progressive elaboration.
options.B: Create detailed iteration plans for the remainder of the project.
options.C: Ignore them, since they clearly have no right to be reviewing your project.
options.D: Have the team create detailed plans for the rest of the project.

question: Which of the following statements correctly describes agile planning?

options.A: Plan at multiple levels, and have managers create iteration plans.
options.B: Use appropriate estimate ranges, and exclude diversions/outside work.
options.C: Plan at multiple levels, and have team members create iteration plans.
options.D: Use fixed-point estimates, and base projections on completion rates.

question: Which of the following is not a characteristic of agile estimation?
When conducting an iteration planning meeting using a Scrum approach, which of the following statements is not true?

options.A: The product owner is responsible for the backlog priorities.
options.B: The team is responsible for the estimates.
options.C: The team breaks down user stories into tasks.
options.D: The ScrumMaster selects the top items off the backlog.

question: You are leading a team with an average velocity of 50 points per iteration. Another team of the same size in your organization is working on a project with similar complexity. The other team's velocity is averaging 75 points per month. Your team should:

options.A: Undertake affinity estimating to check their estimates

question: Estimates should be presented as ranges to:
Which of the following pieces of information are you least likely to find in an agile charter document?

options.A: A list of who will be engaged on the project
options.B: A description of how it will be undertaken
options.C: An explanation as to why the project is being done
options.D: A precise estimate for the project

question: An executive wants help evaluating a proposed three-year project against two proposed one-year projects. Which business case metric would be most helpful?

Your team is averaging 40 story points per two-week iteration. They have 200 points' worth of functionality left in the user story backlog. How many weeks do you expect it will take until development is completed?
When using story points to estimate a project, which of the following statements is most accurate?

options.A: The team owns the definition of what constitutes a story point.
options.B: There should be a company-wide standard definition of a story point.
options.C: The definition of a story point is refactored every iteration.
options.D: Story points can be used for iteration planning but not release planning.

question: On agile projects, generally midcourse adjustments are:
When calculating final project costs, which of the following expressions best outlines the basic concept?

options.C: Time x Rate x Project duration

question: Affinity estimating is the process of:

options.B: Checking that stories given the same size estimate are of equivalent magnitude.
options.C: Checking that stories in the same functional areas are of equivalent magnitude.

question: The term 'progressive elaboration' means:

options.B: Plans are refined as more details emerge.
options.D: Estimates are changed to actuals after completion.

question: You are a full-time ScrumMaster on an agile team. A team member becomes ill partway through an iteration in which the team committed to deliver 25 story points. Which action is most appropriate?

options.A: Work the remaining team longer hours.
options.B: Send work home to the sick team member.
options.C: Start development yourself to assist the team.
options.D: Deliver what you can within the sprint.

question: Which activity does not actively reduce a problem's position on the cost of change curve?
Your team has identified a number of problems during a retrospective session and you now want to help understand and fix the issues. The sequence of activities you should undertake is:

options.A: Generate insights, gather data, decide what to do
options.B: Gather data, generate insights, decide what to do
options.C: Decide what to do, gather data, generate insights
options.D: Decide what to do, generate insights, gather data

question: The term used for describing errors that are missed by quality assurance and control processes and that make it into production is:
Trends in project data are useful since they can offer insights and are what type of indicator?
The concept of control limits can be described as:

options.A: Visual controls that show acceptable ranges
options.B: Change control procedures to help manage flow
options.C: Budget processes that help teams estimate better
options.D: Exception reporting techniques with escalation paths

question: In software development, the process of frequently integrating new and changed code is known as:
The shorthand summary of test-driven development activities is:
On agile projects, the term 'cycle time' usually refers to:

options.A: The average duration of an iteration
options.B: Time taken for work from start to finish
options.C: The time for SMEs to review the product
options.D: Time between releases of a product

question: A short period of proof-of-concept work is known as:
Which of the following is not a form of frequent verification and validation?
You are managing an agile project and measure small amounts of variance in task durations. You should:

options.A: Undertake root-cause analysis to eliminate it
options.B: Engage the team in diagnosing the problem
options.C: Diagnose the issue as part of your ScrumMaster role

question: You are a team member on a software development project and have been asked to follow a test-driven development process. The sequence of activities you would undertake is:
When solving problems in a team setting, goals for problem resolution should be SMART. The characteristics of SMART goals are:

options.A: Simple, Marketable, Attainable, Risk Tolerant, Timely

question: The purpose of continuous integration is to:

options.A: Always have a version of the software ready for release
options.C: Facilitate the practice of pair programming
options.D: Find code issues as soon as possible

question: Fast failure is the term used to describe:

options.C: The last step of the ATDD process

question: On a timeline graph used in the gathering data phase for team-based problem-solving, the line underneath the X-axis usually represents:

options.C: Team risk rankings at the time

question: When diagnosing problems, we ask 'why' five times:

options.A: To get to the root cause of an issue
options.B: Because asking six times would be ridiculous
options.C: Because people unconsciously deceive themselves about problems three or four times
options.D: To fully gather data around the issue

question: You are a team lead helping your team decide what to do about some problems identified in a retrospective. What are some of the techniques you can use?

options.A: Smart Subjects, Short Goals, Retrospective Planning Game
options.B: Smart Subjects, Retrospective Poker Game, Smart Goals
options.C: Short Subjects, Smart Goals, Retrospective Planning Game
options.D: Retrospective Poker Game, Short Subjects, Circle of Questions

question: PMI's Code of Ethics and Professional Conduct focuses on which of the following?
When conducting a retrospective, recognized 'close the retrospective' activities include:

options.A: Plus/Delta; Helped, Hindered, Hypothesis; Return on Time Invested; Appreciations
options.B: Plus/Minus; Helped, Hindered, Hoped; Return on Time Invested; Applause
options.C: Plus/Delta; Helped, Hindered, Hoped; Return on Investment; Appreciations
options.D: Plus/Minus; Helped, Hindered, Hypothesis; Return on Time Delivered; Appreciations

question: You have been asked to review a different project team's recently enhanced methodology to assess its effectiveness and desirable characteristics. The types of characteristics that you should be looking for include evidence of:

options.A: A preference for face-to-face communications, significant process weight, recommendations for larger teams to use lighter methods
options.B: A preference for face-to-face communications, not too much process weight, recommendations for larger teams to use lighter methods
options.C: A preference for face-to-face communications, significant process weight, recommendations for larger teams to use heavier methods
options.D: A preference for face-to-face communications, not too much process weight, recommendations for larger teams to use heavier methods

question: The concept of knowledge sharing on an agile project is best characterized as:

options.A: Encouraged where possible and where the team shows an interest
options.B: Central to many of the practices undertaken
options.C: Undertaken if there is time left at the end of an iteration

question: Continuous improvement is a core component of which of the following set of agile practices?

options.A: Pair programming; daily stand-up meetings; WIP limits
options.B: Story points; daily stand-up meetings; demos, reviews, and retrospectives
options.C: Pair programming; daily stand-up meetings; demos, reviews, and retrospectives
options.D: Story points; daily stand-up meetings; WIP limits

question: When considering process tailoring, it is useful to keep in mind that the network of XP practices is:
The recommended stages of executing a retrospective, in sequence, are:

options.A: Decide what to do, set the stage, gather data, generate insights, close the retrospective
options.B: Decide what to do, gather data, set the stage, generate insights, close the retrospective
options.C: Set the stage, decide what to do, gather data, generate insights, close the retrospective
options.D: Set the stage, gather data, generate insights, decide what to do, close the retrospective

question: You are engaging in some process analysis and have been advised to watch out for the standard anti-patterns of poor methodology practice. The types of things you should be on the lookout for are processes that display signs of being:
Process tailoring is best undertaken on agile projects when:

options.A: There are difficulties in implementing agile practices
options.B: Experienced practitioners want to address an issue
options.C: The team needs new processes to keep them engaged
options.D: A boost in team velocity is needed to meet the schedule

question: Your project management office (PMO) has suggested your project could benefit from some self-assessment work at the next retrospective. Which of the following benefits would they most likely be looking to achieve from a self-assessment?

options.B: Gain insights for salary performance reviews
options.C: Identify personal traits for human resources counseling
options.D: Assess compatibilities for pair programming assignments

question: When undertaking process analysis, what are the success criteria that characterize a useful methodology?

options.A: The project got stopped, sponsorship remained intact, the team would work the same way again
options.B: The project got shipped, leadership remained intact, the team would work the same way again
options.C: The project got shipped, sponsorship remained intact, the team would work the same way again
options.D: The project got shipped, sponsorship remained intact, the team engaged in continuous improvement

question: When adopting a new agile practice, the general recommendations are to:

options.A: Develop the new approach yourself, try out the practice on local projects, inspect and review the findings early
options.B: Investigate the claims yourself, try out the practice on local projects, inspect and review the findings early
options.C: Investigate the claims yourself, try out the practice in small doses, inspect and review the findings early
options.D: Develop the new approach yourself, try out the practice in small doses, inspect and review the findings early

question: As a manager of an agile team, when should you collect lessons learned?

options.A: At the end of the project

question: Information exchanges in agile methods are designed to:
Your sponsor is asking about tailoring the company's newly adopted agile methodology. Your advice should be:

options.A: Tailoring it will be a good way to learn the methodology
options.B: Tailoring it will be a good way to ease into the initial adoption process
options.C: We should tailor it first, then consider adopting it
options.D: We should try it first, then consider tailoring it

question: What activity can the agile team do to list the reasons why a particular process was failing during iteration?
During a retrospective meeting what should the team do after they have set the stage?
An agile team considers the risks on the project and includes tasks to address them as part of the project work. This is done using:
The Kanban board is a simple artifact that serves all of the following purposes except:
A product roadmap is used as a ____________.
The project team is working with the customers to write the user stories. The customers have refused as they claim this would add no value to the project. What would be the best step to resolve this?

options.A: Have the team write the user stories
options.B: Let the agile project manager write the user stories
options.C: Educate the users why user stories are valuable
options.D: Inform them user stories may not be needed

question: Over the last three weeks the project team has finally been able to establish a shared vision of what the product would look like when it is complete. This is an example of?
Which of the following is not a principle of agile planning?

options.C: Conduct most of the planning at the beginning

question: When following the agile method of scrum what is each iteration of work called?
The agile project team has completed the Sprint planning meeting. What would be the output of this meeting?
Which of the following is not one of the Lean Software development principles?
Agile is an _____ term that is used to refer to different types of iterative development.

While discussing the benefits of agile with three of the organization's key stakeholders what would be seen as the main benefit for conducting the project using agile methodology versus a traditional methodology?

options.B: Traditional delivers values all up front
options.C: Traditional delivers value at the beginning
options.D: Agile project requires funding up front

question: One of the customers would like to add a new component to the project that would likely increase the functionality of the software. What steps should the customer take when adding this new component?

options.A: Fill out a change request form
options.B: Ask the agile project manager for permission to add it to the product backlog
options.C: Add it to the product backlog
options.D: Changes are not allowed on agile projects

question: When leading an agile project team what should be the first step the agile project manager should take?

options.A: Determine what software should be used on the project to help them collaborate
options.B: Determine where to set up a co-location
options.C: Work with the organization management to recruit the most educated members

question: During the daily standup meeting the team members are required to answer how many questions?
Where will the customers have the ability to give feedback on a completed increment of the product?
Who is in charge of managing the work during the iteration?

The agile project team has decided to do one of the features from the product backlog. The single feature will take six weeks to complete and will be reviewed by the customer. What actions should the agile project manager take next?

options.A: Arrange the workspace for the team members to get started
options.B: Inform the customers of the six weeks duration
options.C: Inform the team they need to conduct the daily standup meetings
options.D: Inform the team six weeks is too long and they will need to decompose that feature into smaller increments

question: One of the values in the agile manifesto is to respond to change over?
What is the primary method customers will use in order to measure the progress of the agile project?
On an agile project who owns the product vision?
After the iteration has completed where will the team inspect the methods they used to build that increment?
What is the difference between a release and iteration?

options.A: A release will contain multiple iterations
options.B: An iteration will contain multiple releases
options.C: Agile project manager determines what's in a release
options.D: Agile project manager determines what's in an iteration

question: Which of the following is a core value in extreme programming?
When implementing kanban development which of the following should be done?

options.A: Create it using custom software on a large screen
options.B: Create it on a whiteboard with erasable markers
options.C: Only have the team create it using software
options.D: Only have the agile project manager create it using software

question: Which of the following is an XP practice that helps to create a shared vision between the developers and the customers?
Before the team has started to develop the software, they have written the tests they will use to test the codes before they have actually coded the software. This is known as?
While managing an agile project the project team should strive for which of the following?

options.D: Showing progress of work to customers with daily emails

question: The project management plan specifies that a predictive development approach has been selected to produce the project deliverables. Where in the project life cycle will the overall project risk be the lowest?

A company is considering two projects, Alpha and Beta. Project Alpha is expected to result in a $50 million net profit, while project Beta is expected to net $45 million. Both projects could be very lucrative and rewarding. However, the financial controller has stated that the company can only invest in one of these projects. If project Alpha is selected, what will be the opportunity cost?

You are managing a project to build five bridges. The project consists of five sequential phases with each phase delivering one bridge. After the first phase of the project is complete, which process group of the second phase should follow?

The project aims to investigate the feasibility of constructing a hydroelectric dam from a technical, economic, and social point of view. The project charter created by the project manager on behalf of the project sponsor is now approved. Which of the following processes should be performed next?

You are managing a software upgrade project for your company. Your project sponsor has a great deal of authority regarding project decisions, but you recently discovered that he doesn't have much interest in your project. To complete the project successfully, you need your project sponsor's continuous support. What stakeholder management strategy should you use with your project sponsor?

The project sponsor asks for a copy of the document that contains the description, owner, source, priority, and status of product requirements. Which project document is the project sponsor requesting?

You are facing problems decomposing the testing work package into the final activities required to complete the work package. Detailed testing plans and activities cannot be determined until the system is at least 50% developed and more details become available. The system development work package will take at least three months to complete. What is the best way to resolve this problem?

options.A: Use product analysis techniques such as product breakdown and systems analysis to decompose the system testing work package
options.B: Decompose the system development work package now and decompose the system testing work package later
options.C: Break down the project into multiple phases so that the system testing work package goes into the second project phase
options.D: Consult the project management plan to determine what to do in this situation

question: You are about to start planning for a large and complex project. Due to the size of the project along with the regulatory and environmental considerations, the development of a detailed project management plan will be critical. As a starting point for initial project planning, what is the first thing you should do?

options.A: Conduct a project kick-off meeting to inform and engage stakeholders and gain commitment
options.B: Review the project charter to understand the high-level information about the project
options.C: Begin the process of identifying stakeholders so they can be engaged as necessary for project planning
options.D: Share the project scope statement with the project team for a common understanding of project deliverables

question: As you are monitoring the cost baseline for your project, you notice that project expenses are higher than expected at this point in the project. What is the most likely cause of the variance?

Recently, you promoted your star programmer, Sam, to lead the agile development team. Sam was a fantastic software coder, and you thought the promotion would mean that he could now share his expertise with the other development team members. However, you are surprised to learn that the performance of Sam in his new role is not meeting your expectations. Which empirical rule did you forget while considering the promotion of Sam?

You have just taken over a project in execution. During your first week, you determine that the project team members spend a lot of time responding to unexpected requests for information from different project stakeholders. Because of these interruptions, the team cannot focus on their project activities, and as a result, the project is behind schedule. What should you do first?

options.A: Tell the team members to stop responding to unexpected requests since it is not the responsibility of the team
options.B: Push the team to respond to all the requests faster so that they can perform their assigned project activities on time
options.C: Ask the team to forward all stakeholder inquiries to you so that the team members can focus on their assigned tasks
options.D: Review the communications management plan to understand how stakeholder requests should be handled

question: A team member submits a draft of the requirements management plan to the project manager for a review. The project manager notices that one of the components included in the plan does not belong there. Which of the following components did the project manager most likely notice?

options.A: A process that describes how the project requirements will be prioritized
options.B: The metrics that will be used and the rationale for using them
options.C: A process that specifies how a project scope statement will be prepared
options.D: How requirement activities will be planned, tracked, and reported

question: While reviewing your project's performance, you discover a significant variance. If the issue is not fixed before the next customer inspection, your project might be canceled. However, after a further review conducted by the project team, you are glad to hear that bringing the project back on track requires only a minor correction to a configuration element. What should you do first?

A project manager is leading a process improvement project for a factory operation. Currently, the project manager and the team are performing the Monitor and Control Project Work process. Which of the following activities might be carried out during this process?

options.A: Comparing actual project performance against the project management plan
options.B: Implementing approved change requests to achieve the project's objectives
options.C: Analyzing change requests and either approving or rejecting them
options.D: Gaining formal acceptance of the deliverables by the customer or sponsor

question: During project planning, the project team rigorously defined the project scope. During project execution, a senior engineer calls the project manager and suggests a simpler and more efficient design which could benefit the project. What should the project manager do next?

options.A: Nothing, no changes are needed since the project scope was rigorously defined
options.B: Discuss the change with the project sponsor
options.C: Evaluate the impact of the proposed change on the project constraints
options.D: Ask that the engineer submit a change request

question: You are working with a team to estimate how much time is required for each activity. You are using a document that contains information on the categories of labor, material, and equipment required to complete the project. You are also interested in the skill levels, required certifications, and the grade levels for supplies. Which of the following documents would you primarily refer to for this purpose?
While performing project work, a team member notices that there is a potential new risk, which could impact the project's critical path. What should the team member do immediately?

options.A: Recommend the project be placed on hold for a day to avoid the risk
options.B: Document the risk in the risk register
options.C: Draft an emergency fallback plan since the critical path is in jeopardy
options.D: Generate a risk report using quantitative and quantitative analysis of the identified risk to alert the team of the schedule impacts

question: You are managing a project that is nearing its end and planning to settle all pending claims with the vendors. In one case, you are not satisfied with the delivery of their final product. All conversations with the vendor have ended in an impasse. What should you do in this situation?

options.A: Pay the vendor as some products were delivered
options.C: Discontinue further meetings with the vendor and hold back payment
options.D: Identify some form of alternative dispute resolution

question: Your company was awarded a contract that includes a 10% bonus payment if the project is completed two months early. You consider several options to exploit this opportunity. What is the best course of action for you to increase the chances of receiving the bonus?

The quality management plan specifies the use of a data representation technique to show the strength of relationships between four factors. Which of the following tools or techniques should be used to comply with the plan?

You have just taken over a project in which some of the deliverables will be produced by external vendors. You want to familiarize yourself with those who are involved in the project from the sellers' side. Where would you look to obtain this information?
Your project has been plagued with numerous change requests. What is the most likely reason?

options.B: Lack of a detailed procedure to close the project
options.D: Change management plan did not authorize a change control board

question: In the design phase, external experts verified that the team's blueprints for a new crane complied with requirements. During the build phase, the customer performed a walkthrough and found that some welding joints on the crane were defective. The crane needs to be reworked to ensure it can be operated safely. How could this situation have been avoided?

options.A: Outsourcing the welding to an external vendor
options.B: Testing the welding before the customer walkthrough
options.D: Defects are part of any project and cannot be avoided.

question: For an upcoming project, a needs assessment and business case have been completed, and the project management office (PMO) is reviewing a draft of the benefits management plan. The PMO highlights an element of the benefits management plan and requests that the element be removed before the document is finalized. Which of the following was most likely the element the PMO requested to remove?

options.A: Expected tangible and intangible value to be gained by the implementation of the project
options.B: A set of options to be considered for addressing the business opportunity
options.C: A timeframe for realizing the benefits of the project
options.D: Measures to be used to show benefits realized

question: The following Gantt chart displays the schedule for a software upgrade project. The system analysis was completed on August 12th, but the system design and development activities are still in process as of October 3rd. Once the product is developed, the project team will need to test and deploy it, which must be completed by October 17th. The method used to determine the earned value is based on percent complete. What is the cost variance as of October 3rd?

A servant leader has just been assigned to an upcoming product development project and believes that the project is well-suited to Kanban. However, the development team is unfamiliar with this approach. What is the servant leader's best course of action?

options.A: Discuss Kanban during a daily standup meeting
options.B: Review Kanban at the iteration retrospective
options.C: Let the team members learn Kanban on their own
options.D: Have the team attend a workshop on Kanban

question: You are developing the project scope statement. You have specified the deliverables for the project, included the requirements under which the deliverables will be accepted, and explicitly stated what is out of project scope. What else should you include in the project scope statement?

A project manager is in the process of obtaining team members. She wants to understand the availability of the team members required to complete project work. What should the project manager do to find this information?

A project to reduce the defect rate of the manufacturing process is underway. To analyze and improve the process, the project team is now carrying out the quality assurance activities. Which of the following would be the most beneficial for this project?

options.A: Introducing the use of a kanban board into the manufacturing process
options.B: Consulting with a certified Six Sigma Black Belt expert
options.C: Utilizing rolling wave planning for the project

question: During project planning of a large, complex project, project management best practices were rigorously and thoroughly followed. During project execution, the project experienced several critical risks, which were foreseen and previously identified. Despite the meticulous planning, the project failed to achieve the established objectives due to these realized risks. What may have gone wrong in this scenario?

options.A: The realized risks had not been identified earlier in the project
options.B: The risk responses were poorly devised
options.C: The qualitative risk analysis was inadequate
options.D: There was little or no action taken to manage the known risks

question: A team member volunteered to provide the project status update in a weekly presentation to the key stakeholders. After the first meeting has taken place, feedback from the stakeholders suggests that the presentation was not very engaging. What is the best way for the project manager to address this situation with the team member?

options.A: Discuss the issue with the team member
options.D: Send an email to the team member

question: A corporate restructuring project is in execution. The job responsibilities of many key stakeholders are being disrupted, which has caused challenges in keeping the stakeholders engaged in a positive manner. Which of the following actions is the project manager least likely to perform in this situation?

options.A: Manage stakeholder expectations through negotiation and communication
options.B: Develop approaches to involve stakeholders based on their needs, expectations, interests, and potential impact on the project
options.C: Address any risks or potential concerns related to stakeholder management and anticipate future issues that may be raised by stakeholders
options.D: Engage stakeholders at appropriate project stages to obtain, confirm, or maintain their continued commitment to the success of the project

question: You are leading a software development project where the developers are colocated within rented office space. Writing the code is taking longer than anticipated, and you have contacted the landlord requesting to rent the office for another week. Unfortunately, the landlord tells you that the office is already booked. You capture the problem in the project documents. What should you do next?

options.A: Record the issue in the issue log

question: During a bidder conference, a supplier asks why a section is missing from the request for quotation (RFQ). Upon realizing that the section is indeed missing, the project manager becomes flustered and stumbles through a brief reply. When the seller responses were received, all but three prospective suppliers fail to address the missing section. What is the best course of action?

options.A: Hold the bidder conference again, and explain the importance of the point that was initially missed
options.B: Select from the three vendors that submitted complete proposals
options.C: Send a revised RFQ to all prospective suppliers and allow them the opportunity to resubmit their proposals
options.D: Extend the deadline and allow all of the vendors to resubmit their proposals

question: You are leading a project to develop a new web application. Together with your project team you reprioritize the product backlog, determine velocity for the past iterations, and adapt your work plans accordingly. Additionally, you facilitate retrospectives every two weeks. Which of the following processes describes the work you are performing?

You are part of a cross-functional development team piloting an adaptive approach to project management in an organization that has traditionally used a predictive approach. You realize that you have to tailor the template of the schedule management plan. Which of the following components of the template are you likely to tailor the most?

options.A: The rules of performance measurement, the summary milestones, and the key deliverables
options.B: The organizational procedures links, the units of measure, and the project organization charts
options.C: The schedule model development, the release and iteration length, and the reporting formats
options.D: The project schedule model maintenance, the level of accuracy, and the level of precision

question: A project team performs monthly risk audits for a project, where a large number of identified risks have been realized. So far, the risk responses have been appropriate, and the reserves sufficient. An executive for the requesting organization criticizes the project manager improper risk audits, stating that only independent, external resources should perform risk audits. How should the project manager respond?

options.A: Explain that risk audits can be performed either internally or externally as long as they follow the project management plan
options.B: Agree with the executive and submit a change request to update the project management plan to have the audits conducted externally
options.C: Follow the guidance provided by the executive and hire a team of external auditors to conduct the risk audits going forward
options.D: Explain that if the current risk audits are not sufficient, then a comprehensive project audit should be carried out

question: You are developing the risk management plan for your project. In support of this process, you need to determine the acceptable level of overall project risk exposure. What should you do first?

options.A: Determine the risk appetites of key project stakeholders
options.B: Consult the risk exposure register within the organizational process assets
options.C: Facilitate a brainstorming meeting to develop a comprehensive list of project risks
options.D: Develop a set of responses to individual project risks to mitigate overall project risk

question: You meet with your team to determine the life cycle for your project. After analyzing the best way to define and manage requirements, develop deliverables, handle changes, control risk and cost, and engage key stakeholders, the decision is made to select a hybrid life cycle. With the project life cycle selected, how will the product be delivered?

options.A: As subsets of the overall product
options.B: As a single final product at the end of the project
options.C: As work packages of the WBS
options.D: As product increments based on customer's value

question: As a project manager, you are in the process of estimating the team resources that will be required for your project. The challenge you are having is that, due to the nature of the project and the selected development approach, only a few of the top levels of the WBS have been identified with the remainder to be progressively elaborated throughout the project. What is the best approach to determine the team resource requirements for the project?

options.A: Check the organizational process assets for similar projects and use analogous estimating
options.B: Apply bottom-up estimating using the work breakdown structure (WBS) as a guide
options.C: Utilize parametric estimating for the individual work packages within the existing WBS
options.D: Decompose the WBS down to the work package level during initial project planning

question: You are part of a project team designing a new type of a vehicle. You are about to begin work on a work package for the braking system of the vehicle and want to review the acceptance criteria before starting the work. Where can you find this information?

A project to construct an assembly line is nearly complete. The project manager closes procurements, shares the final project report, updates the lessons learned repository, and obtains feedback from the relevant stakeholders. What should the project manager do next?

options.A: Provide final payment to the suppliers
options.B: Send a summary of how the final product achieved the business needs
options.C: Transfer the completed assembly line to operations
options.D: Send formal written notice to the vendors that the contracts have been completed

question: A project team is mulling over two risk responses for inclusion in the risk register. The first risk response has two criteria that must be met and costs $5,000. The second risk response has four criteria that must be met, but only costs $2,000. What action is the project team least likely to take in selecting the best risk response?

A project manager is implementing the requirements management plan for a software upgrade project that will incorporate some agile elements. The project manager needs to quickly define cross-functional requirements and reconcile stakeholder differences to build a consensus among the relevant stakeholders. What is the project manager's best course of action?

options.A: Create a questionnaire and send it out to all of the stakeholders to determine the project requirements
options.B: Conduct an in-person interview with each of the relevant stakeholders to determine their needs
options.C: Facilitate a requirements workshop with all of the relevant stakeholders to develop user stories
options.D: Perform a job shadowing exercise with the intended end-users of the existing software

question: The organizations leadership wants projects to include more agile methodologies. Before mandating any agile methods to be used in a project, what should be done first?

options.A: Pause current projects to align them to the new agile cadence
options.B: Ask employees to vote on who wants to take part in agile projects
options.C: Assess organizational culture and readiness for the transformation
options.D: Provide agile training to those who will be part of the pilot project team

question: You are establishing the relative priorities of individual risks identified in the project. Which of the following tasks is the least likely to impact this prioritization?

Team members are frequently changing during the long timeline of a multi-phase project. The project manager is questioning whether to include agile practices to accommodate the changes. What should the project manager do prior to moving to a hybrid approach?

options.A: Ensure project finances are secured for the next project phase
options.B: Reduce the team size to nine people, plus or minus two
options.C: Target a smaller project as a proof of concept to test the feasibility
options.D: Evaluate the benefits of incorporating agile practices

question: Midway into project execution, new cybersecurity laws take an immediate effect and require audits of the system. The project has a well thought out project management plan. The audits may come at any time throughout the systems development. What is the best way for the project manager and team to address the risk of audits disrupting the project plans?

options.A: Handle the audits as an unplanned spike
options.B: Reschedule the audits to the end of the project
options.C: Request that the sponsor removes the audits
options.D: Inform stakeholders that the project will miss its objectives

question: A plan-driven project has many deliverables planned to be released at the end of the phase. The project manager wants to ensure that the deliverables are completed as expected. Which agile practices can the project manager recommend to the team to make certain that the deliverables are completed and delivered as expected?

options.A: Definition of ready and iteration reviews

question: A project manager facilitates a discussion with the team about experimenting with some agile practices in their plan-driven project. A suggestion of incorporating daily standups is on the table. The team members, however, are unsure of what is expected of them. What can the project manager suggest the project team members do prior to the daily standup?

options.A: Make sure their work progress is reflected in the burndown chart
options.B: Submit the necessary progress reports to the product owner
options.C: Estimate work items that will be developed after the daily standup
options.D: Resolve any defects that have been found in the previous day

question: The project team is undergoing an agile transformation. This requires the team members to maintain their original project plans in the current management tool, but also enter performance data in the new tool built around agile practices. The team identifies that the information in the two tools is out of sync. This risk has been identified earlier in project planning. What is the best course of action for the project manager?

options.A: Accept the risk since agile values individuals and interactions over processes and tools
options.B: Recognize that the risk has now become an issue and implement the planned response
options.C: Conduct a probability and impact assessment to determine a risk score
options.D: Communicate to the project sponsor that work may be delayed due to clerical errors

question: Projects in a program are using various project management approaches, such as plan-driven, agile, hybrid. The project teams are complaining that because of that, the team members must enter the same work, hours, risks, and other data in multiple tools. The redundant work is impeding on their productivity time. What is the best course of action for the program manager?

options.A: Direct the teams to continue entering the data in the various systems
options.B: Determine what tools and data provide the appropriate oversight
options.C: Switch all projects in the program to the agile project management approach
options.D: Pause all data entry until a valuable solution can be determined

question: An organization is to undertake a multi-phased project. The sponsor wants to pursue the project objectives as they have been planned but also wants to accommodate and adjust to new information and changes in the environment as the project progresses. Which project management approach should the project manager select for this project?

Your sponsor has committed to building a high-speed rail from one major inland city, Azules, to the coast. You have two possible routes, either Brazos or Corazon. Given the costs, odds, and rewards of high demand and low demand of each route in this decision tree, what is the expected monetary value of the route to Brazos?

Senior leadership has returned from a conference where they have learned about the agile practice of retrospectives. Even though the organization does not manage any projects in an agile manner, they mandate that from now on this ceremony is included in all projects. How should the outputs from the retrospectives be stored and managed?

options.A: Senior leadership determines the location of the outputs and who may access the contents
options.B: The project team stores the outputs in a location that the project manager can control and limit changes
options.C: The project team determines a location that is accessible for relevant stakeholders to view and track
options.D: The project manager establishes the location and allows the customer to view and make recommendations

question: The resource management plan for an international project calls for a scrum team to be colocated during the regular workweek. However, after five sprints were completed, the project manager got a change request approved to cut costs by transitioning the team to a virtual environment working remotely from their homes with the start of the sixth sprint. After the team begins working remotely, what will be the best method to understand the impact of the change on the team's productivity?

options.A: Check the product burndown chart to look for any changes to the trendline
options.B: Calculate the CPI at the end of each sprint to determine the change in the team's productivity
options.C: Review the product burnup chart to compare velocity before and after the change
options.D: Update the project schedule network diagram to reflect the changes in the team's environment

question: As part of the Plan Resource Management process, project team members hold a brainstorming session to charter working agreements. The team identifies 37 agreements that include communication guidelines, decision-making and conflict resolution processes, core hours, a definition of a story point, how and when user stories will move through the Kanban board, etc. What should the project manager do next?

options.A: Submit a change request to revise the resource management plan to incorporate the team's working agreements
options.B: Verify that all of the project team members support the working agreements and document the agreements in the project charter
options.C: Review the team's working agreements at the start of every daily standup and during the sprint review meetings
options.D: Ask the project team members for their top five to ten agreements and document the information in the team charter

question: A project manager implements the project management plan meticulously but is struggling with leading the project team effectively. There is a great deal of unhealthy tension between the project team members as well as with the project manager. The project manager has had several outbursts during sprint retrospectives, which has caused the meeting to be abruptly adjourned. What should the project manager do first?

options.A: Submit a change request to revise the project management plan to eliminate the requirement for retrospectives
options.B: Take a proactive step in improving his own emotional intelligence (EI) to become a more effective leader
options.C: Reduce the story size by splitting user stories and use relative estimation with the entire team to estimate
options.D: Lead a training session with the project team members to help them become emotionally competent

question: A project is six months into its nine-month projected duration. The project manager reports that the project is at least three months behind schedule because certain key stakeholders were resistant to consequential changes due to the project. What might have been done differently during project planning to avoid this situation?

options.A: Better execution of the Manage Stakeholder Engagement process
options.B: Development of a stakeholder engagement assessment matrix
options.C: Creation of a comprehensive stakeholder register
options.D: Establishment of a more robust communications management plan

question: Two team members are arguing over how to organize the work packages in the work breakdown structure (WBS). One says the work packages should be arranged in the order the work is planned to be carried out, while the other insists the order of the work packages in the WBS does not matter. The two ask the project manager for advice. What is the project manager's best response?

options.A: Work is decomposed and sequenced in the Define Activities process.
options.B: Any approach is good as long as the team members avoid the conflict.
options.C: The chronological order of tasks is defined in the Sequence Activities process.
options.D: The approach should be defined by the project management office (PMO).

question: You are leading a project to design a high-efficiency solar cell. The project needs copper, silver, and silicon among other materials. You have ordered custom-built manufacturing equipment, secured permission to install a solar array on the roof for testing, and reserved a conference room for daily stand-up meetings. What is the result of your efforts?

During project execution, several unexpected issues have developed and are now threatening the project schedule and budget. What is the best course of action for the project manager to address the issues?

To produce the deliverables, the project will procure goods and services from outside the organization. The project manager has instructed the team to develop a comprehensive list of individual project risks related to those procurements. What is the best course of action for the project team?

options.D: Check the probability and impact matrix

question: If a Scrum team consistently fails to meet what they have committed in a sprint, what should be done?

options.A: Give them an ultimatum to produce or else
options.B: Remove low performing members of the team
options.D: Review the commitment process to ensure team is making a valid commitment

question: The Scrum team presently has 14 members and the daily scrum is crowded and running long. The Scrum Master should

options.B: Document their progress and distribute to all members
options.C: Split the group into two smaller scrums then coordinate with a Scrum of Scrums
options.D: Limit each member to discuss only important issues

question: You are applying Test Driven Development writing tests that fail and the development team makes changes to enable the tests to pass. The code needs to be cleaned up. This is known as:

The Agile team is working with its customer to understand how the product works. The customer is learning how the testing will be accomplished to enable them to approve the many features. The software will be developed using which approach?
The columns on a Kanban board show the activities. Completed activities move through the board until the status is
Your team has a velocity of 40 points per iteration. Another team working on another team with similar complexity has a velocity of 60 points per iteration. Your team should

options.D: Do nothing regarding the different velocities

question: The development team needs a spike which is a story that cannot be estimated until the development team runs what type of investigation?
John is estimating his backlog of user stories in units of time. This can result in

options.A: A perception of exact time for delivery

question: Mary is using Planning Poker as a means of estimating user stories. She wants to create her own sequence of numbers. Under what conditions is this permissible?

options.A: When all team members cannot agree
options.C: When a level of precision is requested

question: The Planning Poker sequence is

Your team goes to the daily 15 minute stand-up meeting. After the stand-up, they spend 10 minutes waiting for all members to arrive. Then they spend 15 minutes discussing the prior night's football game. They conclude the meeting spending 20 minutes brainstorming an issue that surfaced the prior evening. What is the total cycle time of this process?
What is the value-added time in the above question?
Approval to make changes in the release cycle usually takes 3 business days of waiting time (24 hours) and an hour to implement the change. What is the efficiency time?
When your sponsor requests information on when products will ship along with the features that are included in each release, you refer him to
What is a story that cannot be estimated until the development team runs a time-boxed investigation between sprints is called a (an)
The "definition of done" means the product is ready to go into production. If the feature cannot be shipped it is not
Team based estimates are derived from
The following practices are used in Lean

options.B: Built in Quality and Elimination of waste

question: A major benefit of Agile planning is the ability to rapidly manage changing requirements
If an impediment is identified during the stand-up they should be addressed
Order the typical steps of planning poker estimation.
